Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of immigration policy on the measles outbreak by stating that it is the sole cause.
Understate: The claim understates the efforts made by the federal government to examine and vaccinate the children coming across the border.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the measles outbreak is solely due to immigration policy.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all or many of the immigrant children had measles without providing evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores alternative explanations for the measles outbreak, such as the low vaccination rates in the countries of origin of the immigrant children.
